articles.title: South Africa survive to beat Pakistan at Women's Cricket World Cup
articles.description: South Africa survive to beat Pakistan by six runs in another thrilling finish at the Women's Cricket World Cup.
articles.content:
South Africa have won both of their games at the Women's Cricket World Cup
Women's World Cup, Tauranga
South Africa 223-9 (50 overs): Wolvaardt 75, Luus 62

articles.title: Pakistani premier hits out at Western envoys' joint letter on Russia - Reuters
articles.description: Pakistani Prime Minister Imran Khan hit out on Sunday at Islamabad-based Western envoys who last week urged Pakistan to condemn Russia's actions in Ukraine, asking them if they thought Pakistan was their "slave".

articles.title: Six Pakistani soldiers killed in a suicide bombing - Reuters.com
articles.description: At least six paramilitary soldiers were killed and 22 were injured in a suicide attack in southwest Pakistan on Tuesday, days after a suicide bombing at a Shi’ite Mosque in northwest Pakistan killed 63 people, officials said.
articles.content: QUETTA, Pakistan, March 8 (Reuters) - At least six paramilitary soldiers were killed and 22 were injured in a suicide attack in southwest Pakistan on Tuesday, days after a suicide bombing at a Shiite… [+1298 chars]
